sub_topic: Finding the chromatic index of a graph.
message_1:
Find the chromatic index of the following graph: 

```
A---B
|\ /|
| X |
|/ \|
C---D
```

Note: The chromatic index of a graph is the minimum number of colors needed to color the edges of the graph such that no two adjacent edges have the same color.
message_2:
To find the chromatic index of the given graph, we need to color the edges such that no two adjacent edges have the same color. Let's use the colors R (red), G (green), and B (blue) to color the edges.

```
A---B
|\ /|
| X |
|/ \|
C---D
```

We can color the edges as follows:

```
A - R - B
|\    /|
G  X  B
|/    \|
C - R - D
```

In this coloring, no two adjacent edges have the same color. We used 3 colors (R, G, and B) to color the edges of the graph. Therefore, the chromatic index of the given graph is 3.
